availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, attorney. Burlington, Kentucky native. Son of John Hilton Perkins and Mariah R. Stansifer Perkins. Married to Lavinia J. Smith Perkins in Madison, Indiana, on June 7, 1864. Father of Anna F. Perkins. Attended Shelby College in Shelbyville, Kentucky. Graduate of Farmer's College in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1861. Resident of Covington in 1850. Resident of Covington, Kentucky, in 1860. Attorney in Kenton County from 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton, Covington Ward 3, p. 255B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton, Covington Ward 3, p. 639.
Geneaology of the Hannum Family, ed. Curtis H. Hannum (West Chester, PA: Horace F. Temple, 1911), 83.
The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky, Paul A. Tenkotte and James C. Claypool, eds. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 710-711.
